result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work and school.
Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Court ordered this case be expunged upon successful completion of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Knight

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler J Knight in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Tyler J Knight.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work and school. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22.
- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time school.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

***COURT ORDERED THIS CASE BE EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION***

Defendant Tyler J Knight in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and Attorney Rosenthal is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler J Knight in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gary Rosenthal appeared by video means. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense is requesting additional time to discuss offer with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case recalled at 3:00.  Defendant in court.  Atty. Rosenthal could not appear.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated and the calendar call date be converted to a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom.  Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler J Knight in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rosenthal has just been appointed and has not received discovery or an offer.  Court ordered matter set for status.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyler J Knight in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/10/2022@2:30pm
